benchmark_details.name: Doctronic
benchmark_details.overview: This paper evaluated a multi-agent LLM-based AI framework as an autonomous AI doctor in a virtual urgent care setting, demonstrating strong concordance with human clinicians across diagnostic and treatment decisions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To assess the effectiveness of the multi-agent AI system Doctronic compared to board-certified clinicians in a real-world clinical setting.

data.source: 500 de-identified urgent care telehealth encounters conducted in March 2025.
data.annotation: Clinical evaluations performed with blinded expert and LLM-based adjudication.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on matched diagnostic outcomes and treatment plan alignment between AI and clinician notes.
methodology.interpretation: Concordance indicates comparable clinical decision-making accuracy between AI and clinicians.
methodology.baseline_results: Top diagnosis matched in 81% of cases, treatment plans aligned in 99.2% of cases.
methodology.validation: Blinded review by board-certified physicians of discordant encounters.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: No patient-identifiable information was used, de-identification ensured confidentiality.
